results.title: Person to person in infancy (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: L. Joseph Stone and United States. Office of Economic Opportunity
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance of the human relationships between infant and adult, and shows that in group care as well as at home there can be a considerable range of warmth and adequacy of relationship.

results.title: Persian story
results.creator_credit: Ralph Keene, Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Photographed during the last few months prior to British evacuation from Abadan, the film shows the magnitude of the Persian oil operations. Shows the barren nature of the countryside, the enormous amount of work done n developing the resources of the oil field, the extent of the pipelines across the desert and the refinery at Abadan, and something of the life of both Persian and British in the refinery city.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ralph Keene, Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions

results.title: Periodicity I
results.brief_description: “Summary: discusses the linear graph and the discrete graph. gives examples of various periodic functions and shows their time graphs”

results.title: Periodic motions
results.brief_description: A discussion of periodic motions by Patterson Hume and Donald Ivey, considering mainly simple harmonic motion. Demonstrates a self-plotted displacement time graph from which graphs of velocity and acceleration versus time are derived. Explains the derivation of the formula for the period of simple harmonic motion and demonstrates dynamics and period.

results.title: Perilous Voyage
results.creator_credit: Len Lurcuck, Oliver Hunkin and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description: Sir Michael Hordern, in the guise of Homer himself, narrates this animated version (in 6 parts) of Homer’s Odyssey! The adaptation is by Oliver Hunkin, one time Eton College classical tutor, who has attempted to present it as the great epic poem it is, and to recapture something of the surge and thunder of the original. Graphic artist, Alan Parry, studied the gods and goddesses, the heroes and monsters portrayed on ancient Greek vases, before beginning work on the series.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Len Lurcuck, Oliver Hunkin and Yorkshire Television

results.title: Performance appraisal: the human dynamics
results.brief_description: This film looks at the performance appraisal in everyday situations, including work. Dr. Alex Rosen, a specialist in organisational performance appraisal talks about the subject and sites that a number of organizations have experimented with a variety of performance appraisal systems, in an attempt to make a valuation of work performance a more productive experience.

results.title: Performance appraisal and personal development
results.brief_description: The principal aim of this video is to provide viewers with the knowledge and understanding of a performance appraisal system, the need for a positive and active role in the process and how the system will develop their performance and career prospects within an organisation. A manual accompanies this video and may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Performance appraisal
results.creator_credit: Don Sykes, Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Management by objectives and performance appraisal”.
An industrial education film which uses animation to review all the steps for successful and beneficial performance appraisal, including the gathering of facts, discussion of concrete, measurable objectives, and actual performance, and development of future work goals an plans. With leader’s guide.

results.title: Performance and development review. Part two
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Performance and development review. Part one
results.brief_description: Two scenarios are presented, the first one being a less than ideal setting for a performance appraisal review, and the second one a more favourable setting. In between the two sessions the tape poses questions, then reflects back on the interview in light of the issues raised. Issues covered include effective management styles, dynamics, opportunities, preparation, personal focus, and dealing with problems.
